text:
Running into a weird issue; not sure if I'm missing something in my code or if it's a bug. In a template I'm trying to change some of the fields on a module but changing both the styles and one of my groups makes it refuse to cooperate. If I remove styles, media works. If I remove media, styles works. But if I have both of them in there I get an error.

```styles={"colors": {"content_bg": {"color": theme.global.primary_colors.gamma.color}, "content_dark_mode": true }}, media={"image": {"src": get_asset_url('../images/stock/creative-meeting-img-placeholder.png') }} %}```
```[ERROR] line 219: Error parsing '{"colors": {"content_bg": {"color": theme.global.primary_colors.gamma.color}, "content_dark_mode": true }},
      media={"image": {"src": get_asset_url('../images/stock/creative-meeting-img-placeholder.png')  }}': syntax error at position 111, encountered ',', expected '}'```

I'm new here, but I'm counting [5] open `{` and [6] `}` in the code you shared. I would guess that's the root cause of your issue. Object literals can be tough to catch errors without line breaks. Maybe prettify the object literal to double check everything is correct?
I've quadrupled checked and I don't seem to be missing any brackets or have extras; and since removing one or the other makes the unremoved one work I can't see that being the issue.
Anyone finding weird stuff happening with theme settings and footers. weâ€™re seeing it on multiple portals
